conclusion: Analyze paths of liquids from points A, B, and C to determine which container they flow into.
Liquid from A encounters a black baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from A flows past the brown baffle, which does not block its path.
Liquid from A continues downward and flows into container D.
Liquid from B encounters a cyan baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from B flows past the purple baffle, which does not block its path.
Liquid from B continues downward and flows into container D.
Liquid from C encounters a cyan baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from C flows past the white baffle, which does not block its path.
Liquid from C continues downward and flows into container D.
All three paths (A, B, and C) direct the liquid into container D.
The liquid will flow into container D after passing through the baffles.
